remarks: Lemma for ~ heibor1 .  A compact metric space is complete.  This proof works by considering the collection ` cls ( F " ( ZZ>= `` n ) ) ` for each ` n e. NN ` , which has the finite intersection property because any finite intersection of upper integer sets is another upper integer set, so any finite intersection of the image closures will contain ` ( F " ( ZZ>= `` m ) ) ` for some ` m ` .  Thus, by compactness, the intersection contains a point ` y ` , which must then be the convergent point of ` F ` .  (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 17-Jan-2014.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 5-Jun-2014.)
